verses.roman:
punaḥ śārī kahe śuke kari' parihāsa
tāhā śuni' prabhura haila vismaya-premollāsa

synonyms: punaḥ—again; śārī kahe—the female parrot said; śuke—unto the male parrot; kari' parihāsa—jokingly; tāhā śuni'-hearing that; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; haila—there was; vismaya—wonderful; prema-ullāsa—awakening of ecstatic love.
translation: Then the female parrot began to speak jokingly to śuka, and Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu was struck with wonderful ecstatic love to hear her speak.
